problem_text:
6.1. Nonlinear singularities at the vertex of a cone
Let ∆p be the p-Laplace operator
u → div(|∇u|^{p−2} grad u).
Variational solutions of the Dirichlet problem for the p-Laplace equation in a cone Ω ⊂ R^n with vertex at the origin O ∈ R^n:
∆p u = 0 in Ω near O,
u = 0 on ∂Ω near O
admit the asymptotics
u(x) ∼ C|x|^λ Ψ( x/|x| ),
(6.1)
see [37] and [103].
Problem. No analogue of (6.1) is known for higher order nonlinear equations
\[
\sum_{|\alpha|\le m} \partial_\alpha\bigl(a_\alpha(\nabla^m u)\bigr)=0,
\]
where a_α are positive homogeneous vector-valued functions. The same applies elliptic systems of the second order.
